bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, August 11, 1916

div1.p: Laura Carter describes her visit to see Henry Carter in South America.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, August 11, 1916
div1.opener:
HOTEL EUROPA, BOGOTÁ
FEDERICO SCHELLER
__________. PROPIETARIO .________
IMPORTACION DIRECTA DE VINOS Y LICORES
... Teléfono No. 825 ...
.. Telegramas: Europah. ..
Apartado No. 358
Bogotá, Aug. 11 1916.
My Dear Mother-
div1.p:
Bogotá at last- after ten days on the boat and
train and a very wonderful place it is- I only
wish we were going to stay long enough to thoroughly
explore it and see something of the people,
but Father, Dr. Guiteras and I expect to leave
in two days for the coast, the rest of the party
following later. We had all expected to leave at
this time, but there is a report of an outbreak
of yellow fever at Muso (where the emerald
mines are) and the Colombian people were
very anxious for some of the Commission
to go there. Drs. Gorgas, Lyster, & Whitmore and
Wm. Wrightson are going and (to save delay)
Guiteras and Dad will investigate the
Coast while in the meanwhile, I have
had a most cordial invitation from Mrs.
Curtis at the American Legation to stay there
and go down when the Muso party returns,
C1
B23
2-
but I prefer going down with Dad and
Guiteras. Also, instead of going onto Caracas
with the party I am going back to Panama
and stay for a month or so with Mrs. Her-
rick. I've had indigestion “to beat the band”
on this trip and Father thinks the kind of
food we have to eat has a lot to do with it.
He didn't intend to take me up the Amazon
anyway, but both he and I were very anx-
ious for me to see Caracas and Trinidad
and Barbados. However, I couldn't get to Panama
from there and of the two things I think I'd
have a nicer time by going back to Panama,
though, of course, there'd be nothing new to see
there.

Last night Mr. Putnam - who came down on the
boat with me - send me a gorgeous bunch of red
carnations on a silver tray- Unfortunately the only
thing I can wear when he calls is the purple
velvet dress and they dont “go to-gether.” However, I
sent him a very appreciative letter about them.
By the way, tell Sylvia she “saved my life”
when she got me to put in that purple dress-
she and Ed. having both advised me to do so.

HOTEL EUROPA, BOGOTÁ
FEDERICO SCHELLER
__________. PROPIETARIO .________
IMPORTACION DIRECTA DE VINOS Y LICORES

Its cold up here - colder than Cartago was and
there's not a chimney in town, so you see
that most of my outfit would be pretty “airy”
up here. The purple velvet is just the thing
for the afternoon - either with my purple
straw hat or the gold one.

We are going to a dinner at the American
Legation to-morrow night and to-morrow after-
noon some of the ladies of Bogotá are coming
at 4, to call on Mrs. Gorgas and myself.
Also we have asked Mr. Putnam to breakfast
at twelve so it will be quite a busy day.

We (Dad and I) went to market this
morning. “Oodles” of fruit - some new even
to Father - and some very pretty flowers:
sweet peas, gladiolus and lilies especially so-
The market people have broad faces and
are mainly Indian I think- All the
men wear woolen ponchos which they call
C1
B23
(4)
Ruanas “Ruanas” here. I got you another
silver bowl to-day - bigger than the one
I got you in Lima and hope you will like
it a lot. I do.

Daddy is very well and sends much love.
Take care of yourself, my darling Mother,
keep well and “be a good lady” and use
the electric fan if it gets too hot.

Please give lots of love to the girls I've
no time to write except to you, but I
know they both understand that- I hope
they're having a pleasant summer.

I must stop now as it seems my one
opportunity to talk.

With dear love to you all from Dad
and myself (Ed of course included) a
div1.closer:
Always most affectionately Laura. Love to Jennie also and remembrances
as needed
L
Please send my bathing suit to the Hotel Tivoli by
parcels post. Mark “bathing suit, (used)” on the
package so they won't hold it for duty. Suit is in bottom drawer
of little chiffonier in the girl's room
P. S. I expect to be back in Baltimore about the
first of October. That ought to be staying away long enough
to help get rid of the indigestion- tho' I haven't had much success yet.
L.
